analysis: The run failed because the evaluation environment lacks the required R runtime (Rscript), which is essential for executing master_script.R. This environmental barrier prevents the generation of the cleaned results and hence blocks the extraction of the required output values.
rationale: The error output clearly states '/bin/sh: 1: Rscript: not found' when attempting to run master_script.R. Additionally, attempts to install R via apt-get fail due to permission issues, indicating that the underlying infrastructure does not permit installation of system-level dependencies. The file inspection tool also throws an UnsupportedFormatException for .R files, further evidencing that the environment does not support the required processing.
evidence_summary:
• Error trace shows '/bin/sh: 1: Rscript: not found'.
• Apt-get installation failed due to permission errors (lock file issues).
• UnsupportedFormatException thrown when attempting to inspect master_script.R.
environment_assumptions: The environment does not have R or Rscript pre-installed.
System-level package installation (apt-get) is restricted due to permissions.
The agent can use conda/mamba or fix-package environment overrides to control dependencies.
recommended_files: master_script.R (to confirm output paths and dependencies)
recommended_actions: Update the fix package to include an environment override that provisions R or Rscript via conda.
Create a conda environment or modify the existing one (named 'base') to include R and the required R packages.
Adjust the agent's prompt or instructions to use the conda installation (e.g., using 'conda install -c r r-base' or adding R to the environment) rather than apt-get.
Ensure that the required results directories (01_scopus-selection, 02_coding, 03_analyses) are created before running master_script.R.
Review the README for any additional setup instructions and incorporate them in the fix package.
fix_package_plan: fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-9832712/env_override.json: Add overrides to ensure a writable directory and to set up the conda environment with R installed (e.g., use 'conda install -c r r-base' or similar commands).

fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-9832712/problem_statement.txt (or input_override.json): Update instructions for the coding agent to explicitly use conda installation commands for R and indicate the creation of the required results directories.
Optional: A README.fix file that outlines the changes made to bypass the environmental barrier.
self_review_checklist: Confirm that the env_override.json correctly provisions R or Rscript in the 'base' conda environment.
Verify that the installation instructions in the README.fix or input_override.json are clear and actionable.
Ensure that the creation of the directories (01_scopus-selection, 02_coding, 03_analyses) is scripted before running master_script.R.
Double-check that the fix package does not rely on system-level apt-get installations, but rather uses conda/mamba as permitted by the environment.

coding_agent_context.system_prompt: You are a coding agent operating inside base-harness. Follow the inspection report guidance, prepare self-contained fixes under fixes/<benchmark>/<task_id>/, and do NOT run any reruns. Never modify repository files directly; only create or update fix packages. You MUST write the fix package to disk under the fix folder (do not just describe it). Only files under the fix folder may be changed.
instructions: If you include any Python commands in your guidance, assume they should be run inside the preconfigured conda env `base` (e.g., `conda activate base`).
Inspect inspection_report.json for analysis and rationale.
Do NOT modify repository files directly; place overlays or patches under /Users/ronan/Developer/agent-debug/fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-9832712.
Prefer dropping fully-edited files under /Users/ronan/Developer/agent-debug/fixes/corebench_hard/capsule-9832712/agent (patch.diff is only a fallback when overlays are impractical).
Use input_override.json / problem_statement.txt / env_override.json if inputs or env vars must change (store them beside the fix).
Do NOT run the HAL debugger or any rerun commands as part of this step.
Do a careful self-review and produce a complete fix package in one pass.
If the fix needs validation, describe what should be validated, but do not execute commands.
Before finishing, enumerate the exact files you created/updated under the fix folder.
